channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Berkshire Hathaway's Stock Is So Rich Even Berkshire Is Buying Less of It
item.description: Stock buybacks have slowed to a trickle. “If Buffett’s not buying his own stock, then why should we?” one investor asked.

item.title: Adobe stock slips on soft fourth-quarter revenue guidance
item.description: Adobe reported third-quarter results on Thursday that beat Wall Street expectations for sales and earnings.

item.title: What's Left to Be ETF'd?
item.description: There’s an ETF for nearly everything, but good ones are rare.

item.title: Oracle bumps up fiscal 2026 revenue forecast, lifting stock 6%
item.description: Oracle is projecting higher revenue and capital expenditures as its cloud-computing arm grows.

item.title: Why Natural Gas Will Stay Under Pressure
item.description: A hot summer and production curtailments haven’t been enough to eliminate the surplus natural gas in U.S. storage.

item.title: These 5 portfolio stocks crushed the volatile market since our August Monthly Meeting
item.description: Investor concerns around the AI boom, coupled with the market's sensitivity to the Fed's next policy move, have caused Wall Street to seesaw in recent...

item.title: China Is Risking a Deflationary Spiral
item.description: Wall Street economists are calling for more fiscal stimulus in the country. But Beijing may still not act boldly enough.

item.title: Oracle shares jump 13% on earnings and revenue beat
item.description: While Oracle becomes more competitive in cloud infrastructure, it is also ensuring that competitors can offer its widely used database to their client...

item.title: Your 529 College-Savings Plan Can Now Fund a Roth IRA
item.description: Parents with leftover money in college funds can now move them to retirement accounts—maybe even their own. But should they?

item.title: Goldman Sachs to post $400 million hit to third-quarter results as it unwinds consumer business
item.description: In late 2022, Goldman Sachs began to pivot away from its consumer operations, beginning a series of write-downs related to selling chunks of the busin...
